results.title: Nanneella Primary School
results.brief_description: This small rural Primary School of 26 students is at the heart of Nanneella and its residents. With a motto of ‘A School and Community Together’ the Primary School is an integral part of all town events and social gatherings. The students are engaging and fun young individuals with clear ideas and hopes for the future. This film also features a performance from ‘Power Wars’, a musical piece that incorporates science and drama and won Nanneella Primary School the 2009 Archimedes Award.

results.title: My Colbo
results.brief_description: This film takes us on a tour of Colbinabbin and surrounds from the point of view of a number of locals. From the Old Cellar and Community Well to Chinaman’s Bend and Marian’s old family home that is covered in writings from the past, this story is full of historical facts and current realities. It also includes the story of the short-lived but successful Colbinabbin Tractor Pull and the once vibrant Lake Cooper which is now dry and has been for some years.

results.title: The McGillivray Family
results.brief_description: The story of the McGillivrays takes place in Gunbower on Saturday morning at the Gunbower Football Complex. This is a portrait of a family that has always worked the land, either as farmers or sheep shearers. They share their love of sports and concerns about the effects of the drought on small regional towns. All with a sense of humour and a never give up attitude that families need to survive in the current climate.

results.title: The Reserve
results.brief_description: This film shows what a group of passionate individuals can achieve to create a place for the whole town to enjoy. Volunteers and paid workers dedicated their time and energy to cleaning up Crown land in the middle of Nanneella. With assistance from the whole town and surrounding area the Nanneella Bushland Reserve is now used by the community for bonfires, social gatherings or just to sit and enjoy a picnic.

results.title: Gunbower: Family Albums
results.brief_description: This film features life long residents of Gunbower and their family connections to three historically rich properties. From Greg Toll’s ancestral home in Kow Swamp to the Old Butter Factory in the heart of the town to Masters Landing on the shores of the Murray River. Each location resonates with childhood memories of times past.

results.title: Colbo Nights
results.brief_description: Football practice, barbequed snags and a couple of beers at the pub. This is Thursday night in Colbinabbin and you can meet local characters such as Slab, Meathead and Stewballs. The atmosphere is one of a close knit community that loves sports, live music and supports each other through good times and bad.

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Training for the last run
results.brief_description: Commonwealth gold medallist Raelene Boyle faced her toughest challenge in the fight against breast cancer. ‘My breast cancer diagnosis in 1996 did see me race again. This time it was a race to survive’. Created in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Journeys with Breast Cancer’ in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.
